item.title: Report X-2023120655
item.description:
Report X-2023120655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the lids was loose allowing leakage. The seal failed causing the lid to be loose. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

item.title: Report X-2023120642
item.description:
Report X-2023120642

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: PLAIN CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023120642 SequenceEvent: Shipment removed from system flow due to noted liquid release and placed in red lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: closures on the inner bottles failed allowing release of the product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipment placed in tote to prevent further release. 2. X-2023120646 SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow and placed in a red line hazmat tote. DescribePack: all four bottles have loose closures DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipment placed in line tote to prevent spills.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO QUAD 4 FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER WENT AND COLLECTED THE PACKAGE FROM THE UNLOAD. CLEANED UP SPILLAGE USING ZEP AND A 3M WIPE. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO DOOR 1 FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023120764
item.description:
Report X-2023120764

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO RETRIEVE THE PACKAGE AND OBSERVED THAT IT WAS AN OXIDIZER, CORROSIVE HAZMAT. RESPONDER PROCEDED BY FIRST TESTING THE LIQUID WITH PH TAPE WHICH RESAULTED IN A READING OF 1. FROM THERE THEY NEUTRALIZED THE SPILL WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE UNTIL A NEUTRIAL READING WAS ACHIEVED. THEY ABSORBED THE SPILL WITH ZEP ABSORBANT. THEY BROUGHT THE BOX BACK TO THE DEPARTMENT TO BE PROCESSED THROUGH DMP

Report X-2023120775

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL LEAKER, PUT ON PPE AND TOOK ALL SUPPLIES TO SPILL, READ DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER READ WASTE DISPOSAL AND DECONTAMINATION, CLEANED UP SPILL AND TOOK BACK TO DMP AREA. RESPONDER PROCESSED AND CLEANED UP.

DescribePack: small puncture hole on bottom corner of bottle DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: It was picked up and placed in a leaker tote with gloves

item.title: Report X-2023120592
item.description:
Report X-2023120592

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-03T15:12:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: MAUMEE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTIFIED SUPERVISOR OF LEAKING PACKAGE. SUPERVISOR CALLED IT OUT ON THE RADIO. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ALONG WITH THE RMP RESPONDED TO PD 11 DOOR 151 GRATES AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. AFTER SEEING WHAT THE PACKAGE WAS AND TYPE OF HAZMAT, IT WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TRY WITH ZEP ABSORBENT. ZEP ABSORBENT WAS THEN USED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL THAT WAS ON THE FLOOR UNDER THE GRATES. THE GRATES WERE NOT LEAKED ON. THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO PSC AREA TO BE PROCESSED. CHROMEX BINDER A WAS THE LEAKING BOTTLE. THE LID WAS FOUND TO BE OFF WITH NO SEAL. THIS WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBANT. CHROMEX BINDER B WAS FIRST NEUTROLIZED USING SODIUM BICARB, THEN WAS ABSORBED USING ZEP ABSORBENT. BOTH DESIGNATED RESPONDER AND RMP WORE THE CORRECT PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT.

item.title: Report E-2024010024
item.description:
Report E-2024010024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was crushed and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum. TLE placed the two (2) damaged 30-gallon drums into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All freight was re-secured and staged for further processing and shipping.
